prd.overview: This document outlines the requirements for developing a user-friendly application interface that enhances user interaction and engagement. The goal is to create a seamless experience across various devices and platforms.
goals: Deliver an intuitive and responsive interface that meets user needs.
Ensure compatibility across major devices (mobile, tablet, desktop).
Achieve a user satisfaction score of at least 85% in usability testing.
Implement accessibility features to comply with WCAG 2.1 standards.
Reduce user onboarding time by 30% compared to the previous version.
non_goals: Develop backend functionalities unrelated to the user interface.
Create content for the application (e.g., text, images).
Implement third-party integrations not specified in the requirements.
Focus on marketing or promotional strategies for the application.
Support legacy devices that do not meet minimum specifications.
target_users: End-users who require a simple and efficient interface for daily tasks.
Administrators who need to manage user settings and preferences easily.
Developers who require a clear and documented interface for integration.
core_features_mvp: Dashboard with key metrics and quick access to features.
Responsive design for mobile and desktop views.
Search functionality to quickly find content or features.
User feedback mechanism for continuous improvement.
nice_to_have_features: Customizable themes and layouts for user personalization.
Integration with social media for sharing content.
Advanced analytics dashboard for user behavior tracking.
Offline mode for limited functionality without internet access.
Multi-language support for diverse user base.
user_stories: As an end-user, I want to log in quickly so that I can access my profile without delays.
As an end-user, I want to customize my dashboard so that I can prioritize the information I see.
As an administrator, I want to manage user roles easily so that I can control access to features.
As a user, I want to provide feedback on the interface so that the team can improve it.
As a user, I want to search for specific features quickly so that I can save time navigating the application.
As a user, I want to access the application on my mobile device so that I can use it on the go.
As a user, I want the interface to be accessible so that I can use it regardless of my abilities.
As a user, I want to receive notifications about updates so that I am always informed.
acceptance_criteria: The interface must load within 2 seconds on all supported devices.
All core features must be accessible within three clicks from the main dashboard.
User feedback must be collected and analyzed after the first month of launch.
The interface must pass usability testing with at least 85% satisfaction.
All accessibility features must be compliant with WCAG 2.1 standards.
technical_stack_recommendation: React or Angular for front-end development.
MongoDB or PostgreSQL for database management.
RESTful API for communication between frontend and backend.
Bootstrap or Material UI for responsive design.
payments_security_compliance: Ensure compliance with GDPR for user data protection.
Implement SSL encryption for data transmission.
Follow PCI DSS standards if payment processing is included in the application.
Conduct regular security audits to identify vulnerabilities.
assumptions: Users have access to modern devices with internet connectivity.
The application will not support outdated browsers.
Development will follow Agile methodologies for iterative improvements.
open_questions: What specific functionalities should be prioritized in the MVP?
Are there any existing design guidelines or branding requirements?
What is the target launch date for the application?
What metrics will be used to measure user satisfaction?
Are there any specific third-party integrations required?
What is the budget for the development of this application?
Who will be responsible for content creation within the application?
What level of support and maintenance is expected post-launch?
